content:
Hey All (e.g. @Rob Hausam @Michael Lawley @Russell Leftwich @Laura Heermann @Jay Lyle @Michelle (Moseman) Miller @Michael Padula @Michael Tan @Stephen Chu @Susan Matney @Jean Duteau @Ted Klein @Reuben Daniels @Robert McClure @Carol Macumber)

I've just been speaking to Jane Millar about Snomed's analysis of the FHIR value sets for

  • Condition.clinicalStatus
  • AllergyIntolerance.clinicalStatus
  • AdverseEvent.outcome

(see https://confluence.ihtsdotools.org/display/FHIR/Free+SNOMED+CT+set+for+FHIR and sub-pages)

The Snomed analysis of these is troubling - they don't have lots of matching concepts, and they asked some hard questions of the HL7 design. It seems to both Jane and I that these elements should have strong mappings between FHIR and SNOMED CT, and that to progress this we need a solid focused discussion between HL7 (PC/Vocab) and SNOMED.

We cast around for options to do a face to face to this, and are proposing to our respective communities that there's a window of opportunity for us to meet in Amsterdam on Nov 19 (day before DevDays Amsterdam) to discuss this - there's a realistic possibility that enough of us from both communities could be present to have a meaningful discussion.

Any thoughts about this?
Unfortunately AMIA is running that same week in DC (Nov 16-20). Might be a conflict for many of us.
ah yes, And I'll be at AMIA over the weekend... but how many people will be? too many?

Not sure, at least a handful of the folks mentioned here. Personally, I have to be at AMIA through Monday, I could possibly leave and be in Amsterdam for the 19th to help represent Vocab at this face-to-face
that'd be tight given you lose 10 hours or so
lol...i've done worse ;)
I'll be leaving Sunday evening

AMIA runs Nov 17-20 and I'll be on at least one presentation that I don't know when it will happen. I suspect many of the folks here will be there. I may not be a required participant but I think we need to find a better slot to meet. I wonder if everyone, including SNOMED will be in DC for AMIA and we could meet there, say on the 15th instead?
I'll likely be in NZ, but @Jim Steel will likely be in Amsterdam and @Alejandro Metke will be at AMIA
Well, I can do a meeting before AMIA in USA. I don't think that the SNOMED people will be able to
I won't be at AMIA, but I may still be in Korea - some post-ISO activities in November have not yet been finalized.
@Grahame Grieve @Robert McClure @Carol Macumber You forgot about me :-(
I like @Robert McClure 's idea
@Gay Dolin my sincerest apologies! I could make the 15th in DC work.
Apologies @Gay Dolin - I could've listed a lot more...
No - worries. I know

Blimey is this finally rearing it's head? Had this in NHS days & kept the ehr model types from the terminologists via a "what happens in vegas" rule. i.e. there is a fundamental mis-match of context. a code has no context (or shouldn't have) i.e. it is what it is what it is whereas in an ehr it is what is it because of where it is i.e. structural context). e.g. High vs low - altitude, dose or mental state? Potentially you could use post-coordination to give a code "context" but.... it's a bit hacky.

there is a context problem. But irrespective of this, the basic notions should be representible allowing for context slipperiness. THe analysis suggests that currently they are not. So I think that there is a problem on either side, or on both

November is a problem... Jane is pushing for us to do this at the SNOMED Meeting in Malaysia at the end of October. It's physically possible for me to make it (briefly) but who else from HL7 will be there?
I will be at the SNOMED meeting in Malaysia - my Expo submission was accepted.
@Michael Lawley will be there I believe
Yes, we'll have several people there with an interest in this topic.
I am more likely to make it to Malaysia than Amsterdam or AMIA at this stage.
Would Atlanta be too soon?
Could create precoordinated expressions but then selecting the right one for the right use in the structure would become an interesting challenge & possibly a potential area for errors.
it seemed unlikely that any decision makers from Snomed would make Atlanta
When is the SNOMED Malaysia meeting? I can start the process of asking to travel, might be unlikely. Any chance we can support virtual participation?
there's always a chance... it's just a question of bandwidth
https://10times.com/snomed-ct-expo-malaysia
or https://www.snomed.org/news-and-events/events/snomedct-expo
I will be in KL
I will be in KL
we have enough terminology people. just not enough PC representation. Not sure whether that's a fatal problem
I can represent PC, too. But it would be nice (even if not quite essential) to have at least one or more of the others.
right - you, but one more would be good. not much chance though, I think
Possibly @Stephen Chu?

Yes, I thought of Stephen (and just now got off the PC FHIR call with him and several others, in fact). But I wasn't sure exactly how feasible it is to travel from Australia to Malaysia and whether it would be for him to come to a SNOMED meeting. It would be great if he could, though.
If Stephen can't, maybe PC can deputize Rob H in some kind of preliminary meeting, possibly in ATL. I'll check with my clients about going but won't be holding my breath.
Any progress on determining if a meeting will be arranged in KL?
well, yes, in that I will be on the Sunday for a meeting. So anyone who can make it will be welcome
You should contact Jane for further details - sorry I have been slow on this - still out on leave
ok, will do. I'll post back here any details from Jane
Hi All - Meeting has been confirmed for the morning of Sunday Oct 27th in KL. Time and Room TBD.
